IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO DEVELOP BUSINESSES & MANAGE BUILDINGS TO ENHANCE EMPLOYMENT OPTIONS FOR PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES. TO TRAIN PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES TO BE PLACED INTO COMPETITIVE EMPLOYMENT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO DEVELOP ENTREPRENEURIAL BUSINESSES EMPLOYING PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES WITHIN A SUPPORTED EMPLOYMENT PARADIGM AND TO TRAIN PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES TO BE PLACED INTO COMPETITIVE EMPLOYMENT AND DAY SUPPORTS WHILE MANAGING COMMERCIAL BUILDINGS ENHANCING EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES.
IRS990.Desc: EMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND DAY HABILITATION- PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES ARE TRAINED IN VARIOUS JOB SKILLS. THE DAILY PLAN IT: A BUSINESS SUPPORT CENTER PROVIDING VARIOUS ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES. VASEFULL FLOWERS AND GIFTS: A FLORAL SHOP WHERE DISABLED PERSONS ARE TRAINED.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: RESIDENTIAL SERVICES- PROVIDES HOUSING AND OTHER RESIDENTIAL SERVICES TO INDIVIDUAL WITH DISABILITIES. THE PURPOSE IS TO EMPOWER PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES TO LIVE PRODUCTIVE LIVES WITHIN THE COMMUNITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Community Options, Inc. and Affiliates is exempt from Federal income taxes under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. No provision for Federal income tax is required. The Organization adopted the accounting pronouncement related to uncertain tax positions effective July 1, 2011. Management has determined that there are no uncertain tax positions at the Organization as of the date of the adoption or at June 30, 2018. In addition there was no income tax related penalties and interest reported by the Organization for the period in question.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PART XI & XII, LINE 2D
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXPENSES OF $25,379 RELATED TO UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME FROM RENTAL INCOME WERE NETTED AGAINST RENTAL REVENUE ON FORM 990.
Community Options Enterprises, Inc. supplies directly to consumers and will track receipts to ensure amounts charged are properly supported.

EMPLOYEES OF COMMUNITY OPTIONS, INC., COMMUNITY OPTIONS NEW YORK, INC., AND COMMUNITY OPTIONS ENTERPRISES, INC. RECEIVE BONUS COMPENSATION IN ADDITION TO SALARY IF OPERATIONAL OBJECTIVES ARE MET BY THE ORGANIZATION EACH FISCAL YEAR.

COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED BY PARENT ORGANIZATION, COMMUNITY OPTIONS, INC. COMMUNITY OPTIONS, INC. USES SEVERAL TOOLS TO ESTABLISH COMPENSATION INCLUDING INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION CONSULTANT AND COMPENSATION STUDIES. SALARY FOR ORGANIZATION'S CEO/EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR MUST BE APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: 990 DRAFT IS DISTRIBUTED TO EACH MEMBER OF ITS GOVERNING BODY (THE FINANCE COMMITTEE) FOR REVIEW. SUBSEQUENTLY, MANAGEMENT OBTAINS APPROVAL CONFIRMATION FROM EACH MEMBER OF THE FINANCE COMMITTEE AND THEN THE FINAL 990 IS FILED. IN ADDITION, THE FULL BOARD IS ALSO GIVEN A COPY OF THE 990 ONCE THE FINANCE COMMITTEE HAS REVIEWED AND APPROVED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, THE POLICY IS REVIEWED AND ALL BOARD MEMBERS ARE ASKED TO DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICTS. ALL CONFLICT FORMS FOR THE BOARD ARE REVIEWED AND DISCUSSED AND DOCUMENTED CONCLUSIONS ARE IN THE BOARD MINUTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A & B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ONCE EVERY THREE YEARS THE BOARD HIRES A THIRD PARTY CONSULTANT TO OVERLOOK THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO AND CFO. BASED ON THIS EVALUATION COMPENSATION IS APPROVED. SALARY INCREASES FOR EMPLOYEES (OTHER THAN THE CEO AND CFO) ARE DETERMINED BY THE PRESIDENT/CEO OR HIS DESIGNEE. SALARY INCREASES ARE NOT AUTOMATIC BUT WILL BE BASED ON MERIT AS INDICATED BY A REVIEW OF PERFORMANCE EVALUATIONS, ACCOMPLISHMENTS, ATTENDANCE, DISCIPLINARY RECORDS, AND OTHER DOCUMENTARY FACTORS, INCLUDING AVAILABLE FUNDING, AND ARE AT THE SOLE DISCRETION OF THE CEO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

ON JULY 5, 2017, COMMUNITY OPTIONS ENTERPRISES, INC. ENTERED AN AGREEMENT TO ACQUIRE COMMUNITY ACTION FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING, INC. THE ACQUIREE WAS A NEW JERSEY NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION THAT OPERATED RESIDENTIAL SERVICES FOR DISABLED CONSUMERS. RESIDENTIAL SERVICE PROGRAM IS NEW FOR COMMUNITY OPTIONS ENTERPRISES, INC FOR THE CURRENT YEAR. COMMUNITY OPTIONS ENTERPRISES, INC. ACQUIRED THE ENTITY FOR NO CONSIDERATION AND ASSUMED ALL OF ITS ASSETS AND LIABILITIES WITH THE INTENTION THAT IT WOULD CONTINUE TO OPERATE THE PROGRAMMATIC OPERATIONS. AS OF JANUARY 1, 2018, COMMUNITY ACTION FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING, INC. CEASED OPERATIONS AND THE ASSETS AND LIABILITIES WERE TRANSFERRED TO COMMUNITY OPTIONS ENTERPRISES, INC.

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CAREER SERVICES FOR PERSONS WITH DISAB
COMMUNITY OPTIONS EL PASO II INC
COMMUNITY OPTIONS EL PASO III INC
